SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Agent
The Agent interface defines the contract for agents in the directed calculational graph.
AgentClassUpload
The AgentClassUpload class is responsible for handling HTTP requests to upload java files for agent classes.
Config
The Config interface defines the contract for configuration objects.
ConfLoader
The ConfLoader class is responsible for handling HTTP requests to load configuration files.
FaviconServlet
The FaviconServlet class is responsible for serving the favicon icon in response to HTTP requests.
GenericConfig
The GenericConfig class enables us to create the calaulational graph from a configuration file.
Graph
The Graph class represents a directed graph.
HtmlGraphViewer
HtmlGraphViewer is responsible for rendering a graph in HTML format, which will be views in the graphFrame in index.html.
HtmlLoader
The HtmlLoader class is responsible for serving HTML files in response to HTTP requests.
HTTPServer
The HTTPServer interface defines the contract for an HTTP server.
IncAgent
The IncAgent class represents an agent in the calculational graph.
Message
The Message class represents a message, that an agent can send to a topic.
MyHTTPServer
The MyHTTPServer class is an implementation of the HTTPServer interface.
Node
The Node class represents a node in a directed calculational graph.
ParallelAgent
The ParallelAgent class represents an agent in the graph that processes messages in parallel using a blocking queue.
PlusAgent
The PlusAgent class represents an agent in the directed calculational graph.
RequestParser
The RequestParser class is responsible for parsing HTTP requests.
RequestParser.RequestInfo
Represents the parsed details of an HTTP request.
Servlet
The Servlet interface defines the contract for handling HTTP requests and responses.
Topic
The Topic class represents a topic in the graph.
TopicDisplayer
 
TopicManagerSingleton
 
TopicManagerSingleton.TopicManager
The TopicManager class manages the topics in our calculational graph.
